SORE utilities¶

IDF weight utils¶

class SORE.my_utils.IDF_weight_utils.PrepIDFWeights(prefix, input_file_dir, output_dir, SUBWORDUNIT=True, STEMMING=False, STOPWORDS=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Encapsulates the setting for preparing IDF weights.

compute_IDF_weights(input_file_prefixes, sp_size, sp_storage_dir)[source]¶

Overarching function to compute or load the IDF weights, as well as train or load a SentencePiece model - based on the settings provided to PrepIDFWeights

Parameters

  • input_file_prefixes – Select files to compute IDF weights for based on a possible prefixes, e.g., only compute IDF weights over files that are derived from the OA-STM corpus.

  • sp_size – Size of the SentencePiece vocab, recommended 8k (input would be an int 8000), 16k or 32k, but this depends on the size of your dataset.

  • sp_storage_dir – Directory to store sp model, I believe this is redundant - self.output_dir could be used.

determine_output_name()[source]¶

Determines the output name for the IDF weight file, so it can be reused with the same settings.

Returns

path to the IDF weight file

dummy_tokenizer(doc)[source]¶
get_idf(corpus)[source]¶

Compute IDF values for a single corpus (list of sentences from selection of files).

Parameters

corpus – A single corpus (list of sentences)

Returns

Dict with IDF weights for all tokens found in the corpus

new_sentencepiece_vocab(sp_storage_dir)[source]¶

Train a new SentencePiece model and vocabulary.

Parameters

sp_storage_dir – Directory to store the SentencePiece model and vocabulary, set in FilterPrep.

txt_files_to_corpus(input_file)[source]¶

Prepare an input txt file to a list of sentences (following the settings of using subwordunits, stemming, stopwords), so it can be added to a single corpus to compute the IDF weights.

Parameters

input_file – .txt file to process

Returns

list of processed sentences

Clean input strings¶

SORE.my_utils.clean_raw_input.clean_content(content)[source]¶

Simple cleaning of the sentences found in the input files. Is called twice, during creation of OIE and narrowIE files.

Parameters

content – a dict containing {sent_id : sentence}

Return content

a dict containing {sent_id : sentence}, where the sentences have been cleaned

Convert json to OpenIE5 input format¶

SORE.my_utils.convert_json_article_to_OIE5.write_sentences_to_txt_file(input_dict, output_folder)[source]¶

Reads the json input from a dataset file and prepares separate text files for OIE.

Parameters

  • input_dict – A json-file containing unprocessed papers.

  • output_folder – Directory to write a txt file to, for each of the document IDs found in the input_dict.

Convert json to SciIE input format¶

SORE.my_utils.convert_json_article_to_SciIE.convert_doc_to_sciie_format(input_dict)[source]¶

Reads an unprocessed json file and prepares a list of sentences in the SciIE format

Parameters

input_dict – A dataset json-file containing unprocessed papers.

Returns

processed_sentences - a list of sentences ready to be input to a trained SciIE model

SORE filtering utilities¶

class SORE.my_utils.filter_utils.ClusterTradeOffs(filter_data_path, number_of_clusters, sp_size, stemming, stopwords)[source]¶

Bases: object

Encapsulates settings and paths for clustering of narrow IE arguments.

cluster(km_model, phrases_dict, embeddings_dict)[source]¶

Use a K-means model to compute the clusters for phrases and corresponding embeddings

Parameters

  • km_model – The K-means model to use.

  • phrases_dict – The phrases to compute clusters for.

  • embeddings_dict – The embeddings corresponding to the phrases to compute clusters for.

Returns

clustering_data - Cluster-information for the input phrases, and results - a dataframe containing clustering info

cluster_insight(results, amount_to_print=10)[source]¶

Print a couple of lines (amount_to_print) per cluster to see what type of arguments they contain.

Parameters

  • results – The dataframe containing cluster-information (in terms of words and phrases and their distance to the centroid)

  • amount_to_print – Number of ‘top phrases’ and ‘top words’ to print per cluster

cluster_kmeans(input_matrix, KM_CLUSTERS)[source]¶

Compute the K-means model.

Parameters

  • input_matrix – Embeddings x (pre-processed) phrases

  • KM_CLUSTERS – Number of clusters

Returns

K-means model

get_Kmeans_model(phrases_dict, embeddings_dict)[source]¶

Compute or load a K-means model.

Parameters

  • phrases_dict – Phrases to compute the K-means model.

  • embeddings_dict – Embeddings to compute the K-means model.

Returns

K-means model

Determine the words that are most commonly used in the phrases of a cluster.

  • amount_to_print – Number of most-used words to return

The most used words…

class SORE.my_utils.filter_utils.PrepareEmbeddings(prefix, sp_model_path, sp_vocab_size, IDF_path, csv_path, elmo_options, elmo_weights, SUBWORD_UNIT_COMBINATION='max', subwordunits=True, stemming=False, stopwords=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Encapsulates the settings, paths and functionality to prepare ELMo (PubMed) embeddings from narrow IE and Open IE extractions.

Parameters

Returns

list of IDF weights for the pre-processed tokens in each phrase

embed_all_narrowIE_phrases(phrase_dict)[source]¶

Compute the embeddings for all the narrow IE phrases, following the preprocessing settings.

Parameters

phrase_dict – Dict with phrases, to identify which document the narrow IE extractions belong to

Returns

Dict with embeddings, to identify which document the embeddings belong to

load_narrowIE_data()[source]¶

Loads the argument phrases from the narrow IE CSV file, and preprocesses them following the stemming/stopword settings.

Returns

Phrases (with/without stopwords and possibly stemmed)

parse_argument_list(string_list)[source]¶

Reads string of arguments (from the narrow IE extractions csv file) and outputs as list. :param string_list: Narrow IE CSV argument-string :return: Narrow IE argument list

porterstemmer(str_input)[source]¶

Porter stemmer - actually gets single words as input and output, so that the tokenisation of TextBlob and spacy aligns.

Parameters

str_input – string to stem

Returns

stemmed string

preprocess_and_embed_phrase_list(preprocessed_phrases)[source]¶

Compute the embeddings for a list of OIE phrases.

Parameters

preprocessed_phrases – List of pre-processed phrases (e.g. no stopwords)

Returns

List of embeddings for pre-processed phrases (e.g. no stopwords)

class SORE.my_utils.filter_utils.SoreFilter(OIE_path, csv_path, IDF_path, subwordunit, sp_model_path, emb_weights, emb_options, filter_settings)[source]¶

Bases: object

Encapsulates all settings and paths for the SORE filtering step.

get_clusters_for_arguments(cluster_model, embeddings)[source]¶

Compute the cluster_id for an argument-phrase.

Parameters

  • cluster_model – K-means model

  • embeddings – List of embeddings for argument-phrases

Returns

List of cluster-ids per argument-phrase

get_weights_for_spacy_token(arg)[source]¶

Get the IDF-weights for the words in a single OIE phrase.

Parameters

arg – single Open IE argument phrase

Returns

list of tokens and list of corresponding IDF weights

get_weights_for_subwordunits(arg)[source]¶

Get the IDF-weights for the subword-units of a single spacy token in an OIE phrase.

Parameters

arg – single Open IE argument phrase

Returns

list of tokens and list of corresponding IDF weights

parse_openie_triple(line)[source]¶

Parses a line from an OIE file that contains an n-ary extraction.

Parameters

line – string that contains an OIE extraction (n-ary, not necessarily a triple)

Returns

OIE confidence score, list of arguments, relation, context, negation

phrase_similarity(narrowIE_embeddings, oie_arg_embedding)[source]¶

Computes the similarity between two phrases, similarity measure to use can be set in SORE_settings.json file.

Parameters

  • narrowIE_embeddings – Embeddings for a phrase extracted by narrow IE

  • oie_arg_embedding – Embeddings for a phrase extracted by Open IE

Returns

A similarity score

preprocess_arguments(arg_list, embedder)[source]¶

Get the settings from the embedder used to embed narrow IE phrases, in order to pre-process Open IE phrases.

Parameters

  • arg_list – List of Open IE argument-phrases.

  • embedder – The embedder object used to embed narrow IE phrases.

Returns

Preprocessed phrases and their length in number of tokens

read_openie_results(file_name, oie_cutoff, embedder)[source]¶

Reads all OIE extractions for a single document, and pre-processes the phrases following the narrow IE embedding settings.

Parameters

  • file_name – Open IE extractions file.

  • oie_cutoff – Minimum confidence score for an Open IE extraction, if lower the extraction will be discarded.

  • embedder – Embedder object that encapsulates the settings used to pre-process narrow IE argument-phrases.

Returns

A dictionary with all the Open IE extractions for a document.

start_filtering(output_dir, prefix, num_clusters, narrowIE_phrases, narrowIE_embeddings, embedder, cluster_model, print_stats)[source]¶

Script to filter all the Open IE extractions.

Parameters

  • output_dir – Path to a directory to write filtered files.

  • prefix – Name of the experiment for re-use.

  • num_clusters – Number of clusters (used to determine output name for re-use)

  • narrowIE_phrases – Phrases found by narrow IE for all documents.

  • narrowIE_embeddings – Embeddings for the phrases found by narrow IE for all documents.

  • embedder – Embedder object, which stores the settings used to embed the narrow IE phrases.

  • cluster_model – Clustering model trained on narrow IE phrases, in order to cluster the Open IE phrases.

  • print_stats – Boolean - determines whether the pre- and post-filtering statistics should be printed.

SORE.my_utils.filter_utils.get_stats_filtered(SORE_style_dict)[source]¶

Print the statistics for a dictionary with OIE extractions, post-filtering.

Parameters

SORE_style_dict – Dict with OIE extractions AFTER filtering with SORE.

SORE.my_utils.filter_utils.get_stats_unfiltered(OIE_style_dict)[source]¶

Print the statistics for a dictionary with OIE extractions, pre-filtering.

Parameters

SORE_style_dict – Dict with OIE extractions BEFORE filtering with SORE.

Custom spacy pipeline¶

SORE.my_utils.spacyNLP.quote_merger(doc)[source]¶
SORE.my_utils.spacyNLP.spacy_nlp(too_be_parsed)[source]¶

Instantiate a Spacy nlp parser (spacy.load(‘en_core_web_sm’, disable=[‘ner’,’tagger’]), which matches a couple of ‘trade-off’ expressions as single tokens - rather than [‘trade’, ‘-‘, ‘off’].

Parameters

too_be_parsed – Some string to be parsed, could be single or multiple sentences.

Returns

The space doc for that string, containing sentence and token information.
